Adventure.Component
Class Location

java.lang.Object
  Adventure.Component.BaseObject
      Adventure.Component.Location
All Implemented Interfaces:
GameLocation, GameObject
public class Location
extends BaseObject
implements GameLocation

This class is used to represent any location within the game world that the Player can explore, and is the primary implementation of the GamrLocation interface.

Version:
1.0
Author:
Firmy

Field Detail

items

private java.util.ArrayList<GameItem> items
This field holds an ArrayList of all the items in this location.

exits

private java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,GameLocation> exits
This field holds a HashMap that represents the exits in this location. The key is the String direction the exit is in and the value is the GameLocation that the exit leads to.

hiddenExits

private java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,GameLocation> hiddenExits
This field holds a HashMap that represents all the hidden exits in this location. The key is the String direction the exit is in and the value is the GameLocation that the exit leads to.

actors

private java.util.ArrayList<GameActor> actors
This field holds an ArrayList of of all the actors in this location.

Constructor Detail

Location

public Location()
This constructor initializes all of the fields in this class and adds this location to the level locations list.

Method Detail

addExit

public void addExit(java.lang.String direction,
                    GameLocation exitTo)
This setter method is used to add a new exit to this location. This overload will call the addExit(String,GameLocation,boolean) overload with a default of false so that this exit is not hidden.

Specified by:
addExit in interface GameLocation
Parameters:
direction - The string direction that this exit is located.
exitTo - The GameLocation that this exit leads to.

addExit

public void addExit(java.lang.String direction,
                    GameLocation exitTo,
                    boolean hideExit)
This setter method is used to add a new exit to this location. You can also mark the exit as hidden or not hidden as well.

Specified by:
addExit in interface GameLocation
Parameters:
direction - The string direction that this exit is located.
exitTo - The GameLocation that this exit leads to.
hideExit - Whether to mark this exit as hidden or not.

hasExit

public boolean hasExit(java.lang.String direction)
This method is used to check whether there is an exit in the specified direction. This overload will call the hasExit(String, boolean) overload with a default value of false so that hidden exits are not included.

Specified by:
hasExit in interface GameLocation
Parameters:
direction - The String direction to check for an exit.
Returns:
True if an exit is found in the specified direction, false otherwise.

hasExit

public boolean hasExit(java.lang.String direction,
                       boolean includeHidden)
This method is used to check whether there is an exit in the specified direction. Optionally, hidden exits can also be included in the check.

Specified by:
hasExit in interface GameLocation
Parameters:
direction - The String direction to check for an exit.
includeHidden - Whether you wish to include hidden exits in the check.
Returns:
True if an exit is found in the specified direction, false otherwise.
